title: Advanced EDA Dashboard with Chatbot

requirements.text: Implement a CSV file upload feature that reads the file client-side (no backend), parses it into a tabular structure, and displays: a preview of the first 5 rows, a descriptive statistics table (count, mean, std, min, max, quartiles per numeric column), and summary metrics showing total rows, total columns, and total missing values in a 3-column card layout.
acceptanceCriteria: User can upload a .csv file via a file input
First 5 rows are displayed in a scrollable table
Descriptive statistics table is shown for numeric columns
Summary cards show correct row count, column count, and total missing value count

requirements.text: Implement a missing value handler section that appears only when the dataset has missing values. Provide a dropdown with three options — 'Drop rows', 'Fill with mean', 'Fill with median' — and an 'Apply' button. When applied, update the in-memory dataset accordingly and show a success notification.
acceptanceCriteria: Section is hidden when there are no missing values
Dropdown allows selecting drop/mean/median strategy
Apply button updates the dataset in memory
Success toast/notification is shown after applying
Summary metrics update to reflect 0 missing values after applying

requirements.text: Implement a sidebar (or collapsible panel on mobile) with a 'Filter Data' section. Include a dropdown to select any numeric column and a range slider to filter rows by min/max value. Display the filtered dataset in a scrollable table below the controls. All visualizations and statistics below should reflect the filtered dataset.
acceptanceCriteria: Numeric column selector lists all numeric columns from the uploaded dataset
Range slider min/max are derived from the selected column's actual min/max
Filtered dataset table updates in real-time as the slider moves
Charts in Visualization Hub use the filtered dataset

requirements.text: Build a Visualization Hub section with a dropdown to select chart type. Support the following chart types using Recharts or a compatible charting library: Histogram, Boxplot, Scatter (with Y-axis column selector), Line, Bar, Violin, Heatmap (correlation matrix with color scale), Pie, Treemap, and 3D Scatter (X/Y/Z axis selectors). Each chart should be rendered using the currently filtered dataset and the selected numeric columns.
acceptanceCriteria: Chart type dropdown lists all 10 chart types
Each chart type renders correctly using the filtered dataset
Scatter, Line, Bar charts allow column selection for axes
Heatmap shows correlation values between all numeric columns
3D scatter chart provides X, Y, Z column selectors
Charts are responsive and visible on mobile screens

requirements.text: Implement a Light/Dark theme toggle accessible from the sidebar or top navigation bar. The selected theme should apply globally across the entire app including background, text, card surfaces, chart backgrounds, and sidebar.
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle switch or radio button allows switching between Light and Dark themes
All UI surfaces (background, cards, sidebar, tables, charts) update when theme changes
Theme preference persists during the session

requirements.text: Implement an AI-style chatbot panel (floating button or side drawer) that allows the user to ask natural language questions about the loaded dataset. The chatbot should respond with rule-based answers derived from the parsed data (e.g., column names, row count, mean/max of a column, missing value counts, data types). No external AI API should be used; answers must be computed client-side from the dataset.
acceptanceCriteria: A chat icon/button opens a chatbot drawer or modal
User can type questions in a text input and submit
Chatbot correctly answers questions about: number of rows/columns, column names, mean/min/max/std of a numeric column, missing value count per column
Chatbot responds with a helpful fallback message for unrecognized questions
Chatbot panel is accessible and usable on mobile screens

requirements.text: Ensure the app is fully mobile-responsive. The sidebar should collapse into a hamburger menu or bottom sheet on small screens. All tables must be horizontally scrollable. Charts must resize to fit the viewport width. The layout must be usable on screens as small as 375px wide.

quotes: deploy this code using mobile web app

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar is hidden by default on mobile and toggled via a menu button
All data tables are scrollable horizontally on small screens
Charts scale down to fit the screen without overflow
No horizontal page scroll on screens 375px and wider
Buttons and interactive elements have touch-friendly tap targets (min 44px)

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive dark-tech / data-science visual theme: use a deep charcoal/near-black base (e.g. #0E1117) for the dark mode default, with vivid green (#4CAF50) as the primary accent color for headings, buttons, and chart highlights. Use clean monospace-influenced typography for data labels and a modern sans-serif for UI text. Cards and panels should have subtle borders and slight elevation. Keep the light theme crisp white with the same green accent.
acceptanceCriteria: Dark mode uses #0E1117 or similar deep background with #4CAF50 accents
Light mode uses white/light gray backgrounds with the same green accent
Typography is consistent and legible across both themes
All interactive elements (buttons, dropdowns, sliders) respect the theme colors

constraints: All CSV parsing and data processing must happen entirely client-side in the browser — no backend data storage or processing
No external AI/LLM APIs may be used; the chatbot must be fully rule-based using the loaded dataset
Do not use Streamlit, Python, or any server-side rendering framework
The backend (Motoko) should not be used to store or process dataset rows
nonGoals: Server-side CSV storage or database persistence of uploaded files
User authentication or multi-user session management
Export or download of processed data or charts
Integration with external data sources or APIs beyond local CSV upload

required: Abstract data visualization graphic with flowing green grid lines and scatter plot dots on a dark background, used as a hero/banner image (eda-hero-banner.dim_1200x300.png)
Small green bar chart icon on transparent background (eda-logo-icon.dim_64x64.png)
